column1: Udaipur is known as the City of Lakes and is a popular tourism site due to its Rajput palaces, and scenic nature. It is also known for its handicrafts
and rich mineral sector. The city lies 415 km from state capital Jaipur, but 250 km from regional hub Ahmedabad.

4. Political Profile: Leadership and Administrative Structure

column2: The urban institutional set-up in Udaipur is fragmented into various departments

column1: Structure of Elected and Executive Bodies. Give
column2: responsible for provision, operation and maintenance of urban services. The
Udaipur Municipal Council is the main civic body. The city council is been
converted into municipal corporation in 2013. Udaipur Municipal Corporation has
an area of 64 sq km after the city‟s expansion, and is divided into 55 wards. The
commissioner is the head of the administrative wing. The elected wing consists of
Councillors elected by the citizens of UMC. A senior Deputy Mayor & Deputy
Mayor assist the Mayor and are elected from amongst the corporators. The term
of these three mayors is for a period of five years.
Urban Improvement Trust (UIT) is responsible for overall development of Udaipur
town. It is responsible for implementation of development plans and infrastructure
in the notified UIT areas, which includes both, rural as well as urban areas. In
addition to UMC and UIT, there are a number of Line Departments (such as Town
Planning, PHED, PWD, Rajasthan Housing Board, RSRTC, Forest Department,
Tourism Department), who are stakeholders in delivery of urban services, and
infrastructure development.
The Public Health and Engineering Department (PHED) is responsible for all
aspects relating to urban water supply, right from development to O&M. PHED is
also responsible for the development of a sewerage system while O&M is the
responsibility of the respective ULBs. Rajasthan Housing Board is responsible for

column3:
provision for development of land and houses, new township, land bank etc. The
Public Works Department is primarily responsible for construction and
maintenance of roads, state government institutions and state government
housing in the city.
Mrs. Vasundhara Raje from Bharatiya Janata Party is the Chief Minister of
Rajasthan. She was elected on 13-Dec 2013. The Commissioner is Mr. Himmat
